title._content: [Brothers William and Philip J. Letsinger of Company D, 14th Indiana Regiment posing with rifles in front of Camp Michigan painted backdrop] (LOC)

description._content: [Brothers William and Philip J. Letsinger of Company D, 14th Indiana Regiment posing with rifles in front of Camp Michigan painted backdrop] [between 1861 and 1865] 1 photograph : sixth-plate tintype, hand-colored ; 9.6 x 8.3 cm (case) Notes: Title devised by Library staff. Case: (front) Berg no. 2-21; (back) Berg no. 2-48. Additional information in collections file states that Philip was a corporal and killed on September 17, 1862, at Antietam. Gift; Tom Liljenquist; 2010; (DLC/PP-2010:105). Purchased from: Civil War Antiques: David W. Taylor, Sylvania, Ohio, 2000. Subjects: Letsinger, Philip J.,--d. 1862. Letsinger, William. United States.--Army.--Indiana Infantry Regiment, 14th (1861-1864)--People. Soldiers--Union--1860-1870. Military uniforms--Union--1860-1870. Rifles--1860-1870. Backdrops--1860-1870. Siblings--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military personnel--Union. Format: Group portraits--1860-1870. Portrait photographs--1860-1870. Tintypes--Hand-colored--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Ambrotype/Tintype filing series (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650518 Liljenquist Family collection (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2010650519 More information about this collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.lilj Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.27248 Call Number: AMB/TIN no. 2385
